answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
There is a lot of information available on the Knowledge Network about facilities management and cutting budget costs. I have included some of those articles and reports below.
Building a Plan: What city and county managers need to know to create an effective facilities maintenance and capital plan, is an article which describes the best ways to ask for and allocate maintenance funds.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3675/Buildin
You can also read, What Works 2002: Facilities Management Chapter, from the ICMA Center for Performance Measurement. It describes management techniques that translate into money saved and a more efficient system overall.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1497/What_Works_2002_Facilities_Management_Chapter
I have also included an article below about using performance management to make better budget decisions.
http://icma.org/en/icma/newsroom/highlights/Article/101306/Using_Performance_Measurement_in_the_DecisionMaking_Process
Another article discusses the Evolution of Your Maintenance Management Program and how to adjust to changing economic climates.
http://icma.org/en/Article/10937/Evolution_of_Your_Maintenance_Management_Program
One case study describes program from San Jose, CA which uses sustainability to help support local services.
http://icma.org/en/Article/100255/CASE_STUDY_San_Jose_CA_Leading_Communities_Find_New_Financially_Sustainable_Ways_to_Provide_Local_Se
You might also be interested in a sample agreement between the West Linn-Wilsonville School District and the City of Wilsonville, Oregon. They have agreed to share the burden of handling certain school facilities.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4809/Cooperative_Use_Agreement_for_City_and_Community_Use_of_School_District_Facilities_and_Fields
I also found some helpful resources that address making your systems more efficient overall.
One is a PM article called Ledendary Ways to Cut Overhead Costs.
http://icma.org/en/Article/4595/Legendary_Ways_to_Cut_Overhead_Costs
Another is a Knowledge Network Question titled, Overall Local Government Efficiency Measures.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/21064/Overall_Local_Government_Efficiency_Measures
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text: Given the current economic climate, an Alliance member is looking for ways to ensure appropriate infrastructure investment without increasing the burden on residents or businesses through higher fees and taxes. What are some creative alternatives to pay for the necessary maintenance and capital infrastructure improvements?
title: Alternatives to Funding Infrastructure?
